duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and manage the rolling supply plan based on the latest demand plan, inventory levels, supply chain, and sourcing variables.

Issue and manage production orders and inventory deployment with established contract manufacturers for finished goods, promotional display materials, and WIP. Prioritize orders for new launch, promotional, and major skus.
Manage contractor invoicing and billing ensuring validity.
Communicate to key stakeholders potential risks to the supply plan.

Work with all cross-functional teams including demand planning, marketing, sales, R&D, and contract manufacturers to ensure alignment with new product development timing, capacity planning, and replenishment orders.
Monitor aggregate inventory units and COGS at Case and pallet locations for capacity planning. Monitor the validity of 3PL inventory and ameliorate with 3PL as needed.

Provide a monthly production plan by Product Line in units and cost of goods for incorporating into the monthly S&OP Management review. Include status reports on new launch and promotional programs. Include the latest Excess and Obsolete summary.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, finance, or business-related field. Master's degree a plus.
